intro: Archihyoscyamus leptocalyx, commonly known as the slender-leaved thornapple, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its spiny stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. Its fruit is a dry capsule containing numerous small, toxic seeds. Due to its toxic properties, it is often avoided by livestock and humans alike.
